main event: A drop-shaped silver object was observed for 15-20 minutes in Topeka, Kansas on September 3, 1962.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a small silver ball with a tail and round in front., It emitted a swishing sound and appeared to flutter while descending., The observer, aged 22, had previous experience working for Boeing during the B-29 program., The object was noted to have two lights on its back end approximately 30-35 degrees apart., The sighting occurred under clear weather conditions with nine miles visibility.
witness description: Gillian, age 22, linotype machinist, previously worked for Boeing.
